newsitem.title: CANADA: Ulster acquires Alberta oil interest.
newsitem.headline: Ulster acquires Alberta oil interest.

text.p: Ulster Petroleums Ltd said on Thursday it would acquire a 44-percent stake in an Alberta oil field for C$30 million.

Ulster said the interest was in the Wimborne D-3 Unit, which together with its own 75-percent interest in the Clive D-3 unit, would give it ownership and control of two of the five largest Nisku/Leduc fields in Alberta.
"These fields represent some of the most prolific and highest quality light gravity oil production in the province of Alberta," Ulster vice-presdient Fred Woods said in a statement.
The company said its purchase represents 5.8 million net barrels of oil equaivalent of proven and probable reserves and over 1,300 barrels per day of production.
The deal would be financed from lines of credit and proceeds from the sale of some of its mature properties, the company said.
